alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Henderson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 12:07PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Quad Cities IA IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois...Iowa... Mississippi River at Burlington affecting Des Moines, Henderson, Hancock and Lee Counties. .Warm temperatures melted the snowpack and river flows are increasing. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is expected in the next 7 days. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Burlington. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Agricultural flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Tuesday morning and continue rising to 15.2 feet early Friday morning. Additional rises are expected thereafter. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. The next statement will be issued tonight.
